Graduating Senior Parents and Students,

We live in a wonderful community where local Loyalton churches rotate every year to send off the seniors with a blessing. This Sunday‚Äôs baccalaureate message has been proved by the Assemble of God Church. This year unfortunately, we are unable to gather in a church, the Covid-19 pandemic has limited us but not all the way. Pastor Joel Armstrong was able to give you a video message for you to view now and more times as you need. This tradition has a long history. The Baccalaureate Service is believed to have originated at Oxford University in 1432 when each bachelor was required to deliver a sermon in Latin as part of his academic exercise. Our students do not have that requirement nor have taken Latin, thank goodness the teachers do not have to do this‚Ä¶. (ekk, some of the staff did take Latin) This had always been an option for all seniors but we are amazed at how many come and participate. It is always open to all!

10 Emergency Medical Responders graduated Saturday, November 23rd at Downieville High School. The graduates are now eligible for Nor-Cal EMS Certification and can work as First Responders for medical and trauma emergencies as a part of the Fire Department Rescue Teams. Emergency medical responders are people who are specially trained to provide out-of-hospital care in medical emergencies. Instructors included Frank Lang, NP, Marty Creel, Paramedic and Bette Jo Lang, RN. Teaching Assistants included Shaun Price, AEMT, Leslie Baker, AEMT, and Steve Folsom, AEMT.

Hello Graduates and Parents,

Moving on to 2-year and 4-year colleges doesn‚Äôt end at graduation!
